item.description:
What would a thriving, healthy and abundant future look like for Greater Portland? How might we design that future given the challenges of global warming, energy uncertainty and economic volatility? How can we link together all the good work already underway to accelerate our progress toward such a future?


You are invited to join with other members for a "social permaculture" and Transition film screening on Thursday March 21st in Portland.  As many of you know, the "Transition Town" or "Transition Movement" grew out of the permaculture world in 2005 and 2006 as a way to extend the power of permaculture design into the realms of community resilience-building. This film does a great job of conveying the Transition approach in ways that may inspire and/or re-inspire a knitting together of similar activities here in Greater Portland.  The film is well-made and easy to watch.

Transition 2.0 is just under an hour and will be followed by some discussion for those who can stay.  This screening is being hosted by a small group of folks interested in bringing together interested people and reinvigorating the Transition work for Portland Maine!

Come prepared to see this material with new eyes and envision how it can catalyze and accelerate the work of creating the future we want and need.

Feel free to bring popcorn, beverages or other movie night snacks to share.

-------------------

Please use the comments area below ONLY for communicating to the entire attendance list.  Every comment and reply generates a new email and overuse of this feature has caused members to leave the group in the past.  If you have specific questions about this event, please send a message to the event host (right column).  Thanks for you help!
